alert.note: Alert for Madison (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 9:15AM CDT until further notice by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll, Madison and Washington AR. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntsville... Hindsville... Withrow Springs State Park... Forum... Marble... Clifty... Aurora... Witter... Kingston... Hobbs State Park... Rudd... War Eagle... Goshen... Alabam... Rockhouse... Best... Metalton... Dryfork... Mayfield... Lookout... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
